page.title: 12 POEM : WHO REALLY CARES?
page.content: {When he was young}he had plenty to look forward to, A lot of active things to do, Working alongside his fellow miners, {Sharing their hardships and sorrows. He visited friends and relatives to say hello and have a laugh or two. Then, in the summer, he'd go on holiday with his wife and children {The highlight of his working year. While doing all these things he kept in good health. {He became older,}as his youth passed away His face wrinkled as he gained {experience of life {He became ill;}unable to go out- {isolated There is no future ahead of him now. With friends and relatives gone, He has to rely on others {But who is there; Who really cares?
